page.title: 03INTERESTING CLUTTON NAMES
page.content: From Maynard Terrace go back up Station Road past the disused railway station to the Railway Inn with its sign commemorating the Great Western Railway. This is where the Lower Bristol Road leads off to the right. Carry on up the road past the present Post Office and the Old School House to the school. We hope you enjoyed the walk.Here are some other placenames. Highbury.....bury is an old Saxon name for a protected place. There was a Roman encampment on this hill. Mags Tyning-this is an old name. Tynings existed on the 1863 map of the Earl of Warwick. Moorsfield and Moore's Farm-Richard and David Moore were prominent local farmers.They were also involved in coalmining being the owners of Clutton coal works at Hillside Farm in 1784.
